Technique: ROUGH-HEWN; WRITTEN WITH A REED PEN/REED WITH SPLIT NIB
Name: Tablet with magical formulae
Description: This limestone tablet, which has been acquired by J. Capart, contains, on one of its sides, a hieratic text of 12 lines. It consists of four incantation formulae meant to avert the disastrous effects of bites from scorpions. Two passages contain a series of allusions to a myth, mentioning the god Horus and the scorpion goddessTabithet known from some other magical formulae dating from the New Kingdom.
